title: Calories in One Reese's Cup
meta_description: Learn calories in reese cup, including full nutrition facts like fat, carbs, protein, and sodium for one standard piece.
assumptions: Standard milk chocolate Reese's Peanut Butter Cup, one piece (21 g), no variations in size or filling.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, exact size, and manufacturing; check packaging for precise values.

quick_answer.text: One Reese's Peanut Butter Cup contains about 105 calories and 2.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one reese cup?
faqs.a: Approximately 105 calories for one standard Reese's Peanut Butter Cup.

faqs.q: What is the fat content in a reese cup?
faqs.a: About 8 g total fat, including 3.5 g saturated fat per cup.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a reese cup?
faqs.a: Around 9 g of sugars per standard cup.

faqs.q: Are reese cups high in sodium?
faqs.a: One cup has about 80 mg sodium, which is moderate.

faqs.q: Calories in a pack of reese cups?
faqs.a: A standard pack has multiple cups; each adds ~105 kcalâ€”check pack size for total.
